definition[0]: to suddenly make a loud sound such as a shout or cry
example[0]: He let out a cry of disbelief.
definition[1]: to make a piece of clothing wider or looser, especially because it is too tight
definition[2]: to charge someone an amount of money for the use of a room or building
example[1]: We’re letting out our son’s old room to a student.
definition[3]: if a school, college, film etc lets out, it ends and the people attending it can leave
example[2]: What time does the movie let out?
